meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of celibacy.
meanings.sent1: The monk led a celibatic life, free from romantic relationships.
meanings.sent2: She admired the celibatic dedication of the nuns in the convent.
meanings.sent3: The celibatic penguin decided to stay single and focus on its career in fishing.
meanings.sent4: His celibatic commitment to his studies was unwavering, like a rock in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The celibatic lifestyle of the hermit was as pure as freshly fallen snow.

meanings.sent1: The celibatic priest devoted himself entirely to his faith.
meanings.sent2: They respected her choice to live a celibatic life dedicated to charity work.
meanings.sent3: The celibatic squirrel decided to forgo relationships and focus on gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her celibatic dedication to her art was like a flame that never flickered.
meanings.sent5: The celibatic knight's loyalty to his cause was unbreakable, like a diamond.
